suggested_query: You were the rose, and I was the garden, the one who tended to your beauty, who watered your petals, and brought you sunlight. And though we were apart, I could still feel your scent on the breeze, your soft whisper in my ear. The memories of our nights together still lingered, like the sweetness of ripe fruit, and the thought of being without you was like a winter without sunlight. I longed for the warmth of your touch, the gentle pressure of your lips, and the soft murmur of your voice. And so, I waited, hoping that one day, you would return to me, and we could once again be the rose and the garden, entwined in each other's beauty.
suggest_context: MEES The rose is a rose. And was always a rose. But the theory now goes That the apple's a rose, And the pear is, and so's The plum, I suppose. The dear only knows What will next prove a rose. You of course, are a rose - But were always a rose. The night has been ours Since we first watched a film It has always been so You now said there was a tension for a long time And I have to agree. Although I didn't dare to admit. And now I long for you in the night A warm, slightly bruised and tender feeling reminded her of the night before, the secret hours in Seans arms before Red had brought the children back. Though their time was limited, she had been well and thoroughly loved, and memories pulsed through her, touching off signal fires in hidden places. Last night had been a revelation. A dream.
